summary: This is an email from Mark Epstein to Stacey Richman dated September 22, 2021, forwarding an earlier email about Jeffrey Epstein's death. The forwarded content contains forensic observations disputing the official hanging cause of death, noting abrasions above the noose line and bruises on the wrists and arms.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Mark Epstein forwards an email containing forensic observations about Jeffrey Epstein's death to attorney Stacey Richman.

persons.name: Stacey Richman
persons.context: Attorney Stacey Richman is the recipient of Mark Epstein's email regarding forensic details of Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email is the forensic details surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

connections.description: Mark Epstein sends an email to Stacey Richman containing forensic information.
Mark Epstein is communicating about the death of Jeffrey Epstein, suggesting a familial or close association.
Stacey Richman, as an attorney, is receiving information pertinent to the Jeffrey Epstein case.

events.title: Email regarding Epstein death forensics
events.description: Mark Epstein emails Stacey Richman with forensic observations that contradict the official hanging narrative of Jeffrey Epstein's death.

keyFacts: The email contains forensic claims that abrasions were found above the noose line on Jeffrey Epstein's neck, which the sender states is inconsistent with death by hanging.
The email notes the presence of wrist and arm bruises on Jeffrey Epstein's body.
The communication suggests ongoing scrutiny or investigation into the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's death years after the event.
